abstract: Office of Personnel Management says hackers stole fingerprints of 5.6 million federal employees, in addition to security dossiers previously reported; intelligence blames Chinese for breach, theorizing Beijing is compiling database on United States officials and business people in order to determine identities of Americans entering China, including espionage agents.
lead_paragraph: The Office of Personnel Management said that when hackers, believed to be Chinese, took security dossiers, they also got many more fingerprints than previously disclosed.

headline.main: Hackers Took Fingerprints of 5.6 Million U.S. Workers, Government Says
headline.print_headline: Hackers Also Stole Fingerprints of 5.6 Million Workers, Personnel Agency Says

snippet: The Office of Personnel Management said that when hackers, believed to be Chinese, took security dossiers, they also got many more fingerprints than previously disclosed.
